title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe any of the following differences between the level of industrialization typically seen in more developed countries and in less developed countries.
The response correctly describes ONE of the following differences between the level of industrialization typically seen in more developed countries and in less developed countries:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct description.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the difference between the primary economic sector and the secondary economic sector using BOTH of the following:
The response correctly describes the difference between the primary economic sector and the secondary sector using BOTH of the following:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

descriptions: The response does not correctly explain how the rise of secondary sector employment affects population size in urban communities using any of the following:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:

descriptions: The response does not correctly describe any of the following changes in transportation infrastructure necessary to facilitate urban industrial development:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct explanation.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain any of the following ways that women’s roles in the household or local labor force changed as a result of industrialization:

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

descriptions: The response does not correctly explain any of the following ways that increasing industrialization can affect gender equality in less developed countries:

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point is earned for a correct explanation.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain the degree to which dependency theory accounts for uneven economic development on the global scale using any of the following:
